history.content:
Yes -- 

This class is similar to previous offering as EE198--hands on ham radio. I've not created the class webpage there -- but you can look at previous years, till I update it: 

https://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~ee198-13/sp18/

The only requirement is that you obtain an amateur radio license -- or demonstrate the ability to pass an amateur radio licensing exam (I can not force you to get a license, -- but I can check if you can pass such exam!). No other mandatory requirements. Sometimes I assign hw -- which you can choose to do -- and most people do, because they are fun!

Passing an amateur radio exam is easy -- but most people don't know what to do with such a license after... and this is what this class is about -- showing you what you could do!

For example, I will show how to build antennas, how to do digital communication over large distances with short-waves, and we will also launch a pico-balloon equipped with a transponder.  Our current balloon we launched 11 days ago is at the Azores Islands in the atlantic!

https://tracker.habhub.org/#!mt=roadmap&mz=3&qm=All&mc=27.77304,-69.60693&q=!RS_*;nu6xb-11

I was browsing the class catalog and noticed EE 194, Hands on Ham Radio.

https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2020-spring-eleng-194-001-lec-001

Can anyone tell me more about this class? What are the topics covered, assignments, workload, etc? Thanks!
history.subject: EE 194 info?
